Problem: Suppose you have an grid. Show that for any points chosen on the grid, there exist points that form a right-angle triangle.

Extension: Show that points aren’t sufficient to get an (axis-aligned) right-angle triangle. Is it sufficient to get any right-angle triangle (not necessarily axis-aligned)?
